ingredients_unique:
• Chicken Burger,Servings:2
  • For Sauteed Veggies
  • 2 tbsp Oil.
  • 1 inch Ginger  chopped.
  • 2 fresh Green Chillies  chopped.
  • 1 tbsp Coriander Stems  chopped.
  • 1 medium Carrot  chopped.
  • Salt to taste.
  • Water.
  • For Chicken Burger Patty
  • 1 cup Chicken Mince.
  • 1 tsp Mayonnaise.
  • Salt to taste.
  • ½ tsp Black Pepper Powder.
  • ? cup Sauteed Veggies.
  • ½ tsp Dried Oregano.
  • 1 tbsp fresh Bread Crumbs.
  • Oil for frying.
  • For Filling
  • 1 cup Cheese  grated.
  • 2 fresh Green/Red chillies  chopped.
  • ¼ tsp Dried Oregano.
  • ½ tsp fresh Bread Crumbs.
  • For Coating
  • Water.
  • Fresh Bread Crumbs.
  • For Relish
  • 1 medium Red Bell Pepper  julienned.
  • 1 medium Yellow Bell Pepper  julienned.
  • Salt to taste.
  • ½ tsp Black Pepper Powder.
  • Water.
  • 1 tbsp Mustard Sauce.
  • 1 tsp Honey.
  • For Grilled Onion
  • 1 tbsp Butter.
  • 1 medium Onion  cut in thick slices.
  • Salt to taste.
  • A pinch Black Pepper Powder.
  • Other Ingredients
  • 2 Burger Buns.
  • 1 tbsp Mayonnaise.
  • 1 medium Tomato  sliced.
  • 1 medium Cucumber  sliced.
  • A few Iceberg lettuce Leaves.
  • Relish.
  • Grilled Onions.
  • Mayonnaise.
  • 2 Cheese Slices.
instructions_unique:
1. For Sauteed Veggies
  2. In a pan heat oil and add ginger, green chillies, coriander stem saute for half a minute and add carrot.
  3. Now saute them for a minute on medium heat and then add salt, water and mix it once.
  4. Cover and let it cook for 2-3 minutes or until half done.
  5. Switch off the flames and keep it aside to cool down.
  6. For Filling
  7. In a bowl mix cheese, green/red chillies, dried oregano, bread crumbs and mix everything properly and keep aside for further use.
  8. For Chicken Burger Patty
  9. In a bowl add chicken mince, mayonnaise and mix it properly until well combined.
  10. Now add salt, black pepper powder, sauteed veggies, dried oregano, fresh bread crumbs and mix everything properly.
  11. Now apply some water on your hands and take a portion of the mixture and spread it a little in your hand then add a generous amount of filling in the centre then close it up and give it a patty shape.
  12. Then roll it in the bread crumbs, keep aside and repeat for the rest of the mixture.
  13. Heat a pan with oil in it on medium heat now place the parties in the hot oil and shallow fry them until golden brown and crispy from both sides. Remove and keep aside.
  14. For Relish
  15. In a hot pan add red bell pepper, yellow bell peppers, salt, black pepper powder and saute for half a minute.
  16. Now add water, mustard sauce, honey and mix everything properly then continue cooking for 1-2 minutes.
  17. Then remove and keep aside for further use.
  18. For Grilled Onion
  19. In a pan heat butter then add sliced onions and let them charr on high flames for a minute from both sides.
  20. Remove and sprinkle some salt, black pepper powder and keep aside for further use.
  21. Then in the same pan taste both half of the burger buns until golden and crispy.
  22. For Assembling The Chicken Burger
  23. Apply mayonnaise to the toasted buns then place sliced tomatoes, cucumber, some lettuce leaves on the bottom part of the bun.
  24. Now place the chicken patty then on it add some relish, some grilled onions, more mayonnaise, cheese slices and place the top of the buns and secure it with a wooden skewer. Serve immediately.

ingredients_unique: • 1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast . 1 cup warm water. ¼ cup white sugar. 3 tablespoons milk. 1 large egg, beaten. 2 teaspoons salt. 4 ½ cups bread flour. 2 teaspoons minced garlic (Optional). ¼ cup butter, melted.
instructions_unique: 1. Dissolve yeast in warm water in a large bowl. Let stand about 10 minutes, until frothy. Meanwhile, generously oil a large bowl. Stir sugar, milk, egg, and salt into the yeast mixture. Mix in enough flour to make a soft dough. Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth, 6 to 8 minutes. Place dough in the prepared oil, cover with a damp cloth, and let rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Punch down dough on a lightly floured surface, and knead in garlic. Pinch off small handfuls of dough about the size of a golf ball; you should have about 14. Roll each piece into a ball and place on a tray. Cover with a towel, and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat a large grill pan over high heat. Roll each piece of dough into a thin circle. Brush some melted butter on the preheated grill pan. Place a few pieces of dough in the pan (as many as you can fit) and cook until puffy and lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Brush butter onto the uncooked sides, flip, and cook until browned, 2 to 4 more minutes. Remove from the grill and repeat to cook the remaining naan. Enjoy!

ingredients_unique:
• Servings: 4
  • 2 ½ cups Water.
  • ½ inch Ginger, peeled & crushed.
  • 4 tsp Sugar.
  • 2 tsp black Tea leaves.
  • 1 ½ cups Milk.
instructions_unique:
1. In a saucepot, add water and let it boil.
  2. Once it s boiling, add crushed ginger and let it simmer on medium flame.
  3. Add sugar, black tea leaves and let it boil.
  4. Now , add milk and boil for 2-3 minutes.
  5. With the help of a small strainer, filter the chai, separate the tea leaves and pour into cups.
  6. Serve hot chai with biscuits.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:2
  • 1 cup whole wheat flour. 1 cup all-purpose flour. 1 teaspoon salt. ¾ cup hot water or as needed. 2 tablespoons olive oil or vegetable oil.
instructions_unique: 1. Mix whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, and salt in a large bowl. Use a wooden spoon to stir in water and oil. Mix until a soft, elastic dough forms and add more water, if needed. Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Divide dough into 10 equal portions, or less if you want larger chapatis. Roll each piece into a ball and let rest for a few minutes. Heat a lightly greased skillet over medium heat. Use a rolling pin to roll dough balls out on a lightly floured surface until very thin. When the skillet starts to smoke, place a chapati in it. Cook until bottom has brown spots, about 30 seconds, then flip and cook 30 seconds more. Repeat to cook remaining chapatis.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings: 2
  • For Bhature With Yeast
  • 1 ½ cup Refined flour. ½ tsp Sugar. Salt to taste. ½ tsp Oil. 5 gms Dry Yeast soaked in water & sugar. Water. 2 tbsp Semolina, soaked in water. 1 tsp Oil.
  • For Pressure Cooking Chole
  • 1 ½ cups Chickpeas, soaked, overnight. 4-5 Dry Amla. 1 Dry red chilli. 2 Black cardamom.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 1 tsp Baking soda.
  • 1 Bay leaf.
  • 2 tbsp Tea powder.
  • Water as required.
  • For Pressure Cooking Chole
  • 1 ½ cups Chickpeas. soaked, overnight.
  • 4-5 Dry Amla.
  • 1 Dry red chilli.
  • 2 Black cardamom.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 1 tsp Baking soda.
  • 1 Bay leaf.
  • 2 tbsp Tea powder.
  • Water as required.
  • For Chole Masala
  • 2-4 Black cardamom.
  • 10-12 Black peppercorns.
  • 2-3 Green cardamom.
  • 2 Mace.
  • ½ tbsp Dry fenugreek leaves.
  • 1 inch Cinnamon stick.
  • ½ Nutmeg.
  • 1 Star anise.
  • 2-4 Cloves.
  • ¼ tsp Fenugreek seeds.
  • 1 tbsp Coriander powder.
  • A pinch of asafoetida.
  • ½ tsp Degi red chilli powder.
  • ½ tsp Cumin powder.
  • For Tempering Chole
  • ¼ cup Ghee.
  • Prepared Chole Masala.
  • 5 tbsp Black tamarind water, soaked.
  • ½ cup Remaining chole water.
  • 1 inch Ginger, julienned.
  • 2 tbsp Ghee.
  • For Fried Aloo
  • 2 medium Potatoes, boiled & cubed.
  • Oil for frying.
  • Salt to taste.
  • ½ tsp Degi red chilli powder.
  • 1 tsp Dry mango powder.
  • For Garnish
  • 1 medium Onion, slice.
  • 2 fresh Green chillies.
  • ½ inch Ginger, julienned.
  • Green chutney.
  • Few fresh Coriander sprig
instructions_unique:
1. For Bhature With Yeast
  2. In a parat, add refined flour, sugar, salt to taste, oil, dry yeast soaked in water, semolina soaked in water for 1 hour and mix well making sure everything is well combined.
  3. Further, add water as required and knead the dough.
  4. Knead to the smooth and soft dough without putting much pressure.
  5. Grease the dough with oil, cover and rest for 1 hours.
  6. Pinch a ball sized dough and make a ball without any cracks.
  7. Roll slightly thick, applying oil to prevent it from sticking.
  8. Cover and rest for 15 minutes.
  9. Finally, roll the dough evenly into circles using a rolling pin. roll neither too thin or thick.
  10. Heat oil in a deep kadai. When the oil is sufficiently hot, add one bhatura.
  11. Press with the spoon to puff up.
  12. Also once they begin to puff, splash oil over the bhatura till they puff completely.
  13. Flip over and fry the bhatura till golden brown all over.
  14. Then drain the bhature into tissue paper to remove excess oil. Fry all bhature the same way.
  15. For Pressure Cooking Chole
  16. In a pressure cooker, add soaked chickpeas, dry amla, dry red chilli, black cardamom, salt to taste, baking soda, bay leaf, tea powder and water as required.
  17. Cover and pressure cook for 5 whistles. If you do not have tea bags, then you can prepare tea decoction and add it to the cooker.
  18. Once the pressure releases, open the cooker and discard the tea bags. keep aside.
  19. Strain the chloe and keep the remaining water for later use.
  20. For Chole Masala
  21. In a bowl, add Black cardamom, Black peppercorns, Green cardamom, Mace, Dry fenugreek leaves.
  22. Add Cinnamon stick, Nutmeg, Star anise, Cloves, Fenugreek seeds.
  23. Transfer this into the pan and dry roast until the spices turn aromatic.
  24. Add coriander powder, A pinch of asafoetida, Degi red chilli powder, Cumin powder and dry roast well.
  25. Transfer it into a grinder jar and grind it finely. Keep it aside for further use.
  26. For Tempering Chole
  27. In a kadai, heat ghee, add pressure cooked chole, prepared chole masala, black tamarind water.
  28. Mix everything well to make sure the chole doesn t break.
  29. Adjust consistency by adding remaining chole water.
  30. Simmer for 15-20 minutes on low flame, or until chole absorbs all the flavour.
  31. At the end, add ginger and ghee.
  32. Garnished with ginger, ghee, green chillies, fried aloo, sliced onion and coriander sprig.
  33. Serve hot with fried bhature and green chutney.
  34. For Fried Aloo
  35. Heat oil in a kadai, add boiled & cubed potatoes and fry until crisp and golden brown from all the sides.
  36. Onces it s crisp, transfer it into a bowl.
  37. Add salt to taste, degi red chilli powder, dry mango powder and toss it well.
  38. Keep aside for further use.
  39. Note :- Note leave the chole in the boiled tea powder water to get a better dark color.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings: 4
  • 200 gms soaked black lentil (sabut urad dal).
  • 3 tbsp Garlic water.
  • ¼ cup butter.
  • water as required.
  • For tempering
  • ½ tbsp ghee.
  • 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste
  • 1 tsp degi red chilli powder
  • 1 ½ cup tomato puree
  • ¼ cup butter
  • Salt to taste
  • For 2nd tempering
  • 2 tbsp ghee.
  • 1 tsp Kasuri methi.
  • ½ tsp degi red chilli powder.
  • 2 tbsp water.
  • ¼ cup butter.
  • For garnish
  • 2-3 butter cubes.
  • ½ tbsp fresh cream.
instructions_unique:
1. Wash and soak urad dal, overnight.
  2. In a heavy bottom pot add dal and garlic water and let it cook for at least for 1.5 hours on a low flame.
  3. Once dal is cooked add butter into it.
  4. For tempering:-
  5. Heat ghee in a pan, add ginger garlic paste, degi red chilli powder, fresh tomato puree. SautÃ© till the tomato puree is well cooked.
  6. Add the tempering to cooked dal and mash it.
  7. Add butter and salt to it and cook until well combined.
  8. For 2nd tempering:-
  9. Heat ghee in a pan, add kasuri methi, degi red chilli powder and water.
  10. Add the tempering to the dal, add butter and give it a boil.
  11. Serve hot in a serving bowl and garnish with cream and butter cubes and serve with hot roti or jeera rice.

ingredients_unique:
• Instant Dhokla,Servings:2
  • 1 cup gram flour/ besan.
  • 1 cup rawa.
  • a pinch asafetida.
  • ½ tsp turmeric.
  • 1 tsp baking powder.
  • 1 tsp baking soda.
  • 1 tsp green chili paste.
  • 2 tbsp curd.
  • salt to taste.
  • water as required.
  • 1 tsp oil.
  • For Tempering
  • 1 tbsp oil.
  • 1 tsp mustard seeds.
  • ½ tsp cumin seeds.
  • 5-6 curry leaves.
  • a pinch asfetida.
  • 1 tbsp sesame seeds toasted.
instructions_unique:
1. In mixing bowl add besan, rawa, green chili paste, turmeric, salt, curd, baking powder and baking soda. Mix well and add water as required to thick consistency. Let it stand for 5 minutes.
  2. Transfer this batter into greased mould and steam for 10-12 minutes or until dhokla is cooked.
  3. Meanwhile make tempering; heat oil and crackle mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, asafetida.
  4. Pour this over dhokla and sprinkle toasted sesame seeds. Cut into 1 inch square triangular shape. Serve immediately.

ingredients_unique:
• Vegetable Fried Rice Servings:.2
  • 1 tbsp Oil
  • 2-3 Garlic Cloves, finely chopped.
  • 1 inch Ginger, finely chopped.
  • 2-3 Green Chillies, finely chopped.
  • ¾ cup Baby Corns, chopped.
  • ¾ cup Green Beans, chopped.
  • ¾ cup Carrot, chopped.
  • ¾ cup Green Peas.
  • 1 cup Basmati Rice, cooked.
  • ½ tsp Sugar.
  • 1 tbsp Soya Sauce.
  • 1 tsp White Pepper powder.
  • 1 tsp Vinegar.
  • Salt to taste.
  • Chopped Spring Onion greens, for garnish.
instructions_unique:
1. Heat oil in wok, add garlic, ginger and cook for a minute.
  2. Add green chillies, and all the vegetables, cook for another 2-3 minutes.
  3. Add cooked rice and toss well with light hands. Cook for a minute.
  4. Now add sugar, soya sauce, white pepper powder, vinegar and salt, toss well to incorporate everything well. Cook for another minute.
  5. Garnish with spring onion greens.
  6. Serve immediately.

ingredients_unique:
• Rawa Idli,Servings:2
  • 2 tbsp Oil.
  • 1 tbsp Mustard seeds.
  • 1 tbsp Gota urad.
  • ¼ tsp Asafoetida.
  • 1 tbsp Red & Green chilli, chopped.
  • 7-8 cashew, broken.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 1 inch Ginger, chopped.
  • 1 cup Semolina/ Rava.
  • Oil, for greasing.
  • ½ cup yoghurt/ fresh or sour.
  • Coriander leaves, chopped.
  • A pinch of Asafoetida/ hing.
  • 1 tbsp fruit salt.
  • For garnish
  • Roasted cashew.
instructions_unique:
1. In a pan heat oil, add mustard seeds, gota urad, Asafoetida, red chill, green chilli and broken cashew saute well.
  2. Add salt to taste, add ginger and semolina and roast well on medium flame.
  3. Transfer it to a bowl, add curd and water mix it properly and keep aside for 20 minutes.
  4. Now add fruit salt and mix well.
  5. Grease the idli mould, pour the batter and keep half cashew on each.
  6. Steam at higher temperature for 3-4 minutes.
  7. Serve with coconut chutney.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:4
  • For Sugar Syrup
  • 1 Cup Sugar.
  • ¾ Cup Water.
  • ½ lemon juice.
  • ½ tsp Saffron Strands.
  • For Khameer Jalebi
  • 1 Cup Refined Flour
  • ½ tsp yeast.
  • 2 tsp gram flour.
  • ½ cup water.
  • For Instant Jalebi
  • 1 Cup Refined Flour.
  • ¼ Cup Yogurt.
  • 1 tsp Vinegar.
  • ½ tsp Baking Powder.
  • Other Ingredients
  • Ghee or Oil, for deep frying.
instructions_unique:
1. For Sugar Syrup
  2. Add sugar and water in a pot, heat on medium flame.
  3. When the sugar melts, add lemon juice and keep stirring till one string consistency is achieved.
  4. Now add in saffron and mix well. Turn off the flame and set aside till in use.
  5. For Khameer Jalebi
  6. Mix refined flour, yeast, gram flour & water in a bowl. Set aside for 6-7 hours to ferment.
  7. Once the batter ferments, beat it once again and mix.
  8. While mixing the ingredients, the batter will remain thicker than the usual batters as the starch will break down while fermenting and the batter will get thin.
  9. For Instant Jalebi 
  10. In a mixing bowl combine refined flour, baking powder, vinegar, yogurt and mix well. Set aside for 5-7 minutes.
  11. Add ½ cup water and whisk till there are no lumps.
  12. Now whisk for 2 mins so the air incorporates.
  13. For Making Jalebis-
  14. Fill the prepared batter in piping bag or ketchup bottle.
  15. Heat oil for deep frying in a wide mouth pan.
  16. Form round whirls working closely from outside to the centre.
  17. Fry the jalebis till golden in colour. Remove the jalebi and immediately steep in prepared sugar syrup.
  18. Soak the jalebis for 3-4mins. Remove and arrange on a plate.
  19. Repeat till all the batter is used up. Serve hot.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:4
  • Whole wheat chapatis 4.
  • Onion 1 medium.
  • Green capsicum 1 medium.
  • Tomatoes chopped 2 medium.
  • Turmeric powder 1 teaspoon.
  • Ginger-garlic paste 2- tablespoons.
  • Tomato puree 2-3 tablespoons.
  • Paneer (cottage cheese) 1 cup.
  • Salt to taste.
  • Red chilli powder 1/2 teaspoon.
  • Garam masala powder 1/4 teaspoon.
  • Coriander and mint chutney 2 tablespoons.
  • Yogurt 1/4 cup.
  • Fresh mint leave to serve.
  • Onion rings to serve.
  • Chaat masala to serve.
instructions_unique:
1. Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Slice onion and add. Chop green capsicum.
  2. Add tomatoes, turmeric powder and ginger-garlic paste to the pan. Mix well and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes. Add tomato puree. Mix well and cook on high heat for a minute.
  3. Add capsicum, cottage cheese, salt, red chilli powder and garam masala powder. Mix well and cook till done. Place a chapatti on a worktop.
  4. Mix mint-coriander chutney and yogurt and spread a spoonful of yogurt-chutney evenly on it. Place a spoonful of the vegetable filling on one side of the chapatti.
  5. Sprinkle a few fresh mint leaves, onion rings and chaat masala on top. Roll the chapatti tightly.
  6. Make other kathi rolls similarly. Cut into halves and serve immediately.
Nutrition_Facts (per serving):
Calories : 506.7 kcal Kcal
Carbohydrates : 58.0 gm gm
Protein : 16.4 gm gm
Fat : 22.5 gm gm
Other : 2.3 gm

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:4
  • For kadai masala
  • 11/2 tsp Coriander seeds.
  • 2 tsp Cumin seeds.
  • 4-5 Kashmiri Red Chilli.
  • 11/2 tbsp Peppercorns.
  • 1 tbsp salt.
  • For Kadai Paneer
  • 1 tbsp Oil.
  • 1 tsp Cumin seeds.
  • 1 inch Ginger, chopped.
  • 2 large Onion, chopped.
  • 1 tsp Ginger garlic paste.
  • ½ tsp Turmeric Powder.
  • 1 tsp Degi chilli powder.
  • 1 tsp Coriander powder.
  • 2 large Tomatoes, puree.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 1 tsp Ghee.
  • 1 tsp Oil.
  • 1 Medium onion, slice.
  • ½ Capsicum, slice.
  • 1 Tomato, slice.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 250 Gram paneer, slice.
  • 1 tsp Kashmiri chilli powder.
  • 1 tbsp kadai masala.
  • 1 tbsp Cream/ optional.
  • Coriander Sprig.
instructions_unique:
1. For Kadai masala Take a pan.
  2. Add coriander seeds, cumin seeds, Kashmiri red chilli, peppercorn and salt.
  3. Dry roast it till you get a nutty aroma..
  4. Let it cool and grind it into fine powder.
  5. For Kadai Paneer
  6. Take a pan, add oil/ghee.
  7. Now add cumin, ginger and saute well
  8. Add onion, ginger garlic paste and saute till raw smell goes off.
  9. Add turmeric powder, degi chilli powder and coriander powder and saute well.
  10. Add tomato puree, salt to taste and water and let it cook.
  11. Take a pan, add oil/ ghee.
  12. Add slice onion, slice capcium, slice tomato and salt and saute for a minute.
  13. Add paneer slice to it and saute well.
  14. Add kashmiri chilli powder and prepared kadai masala to it and saute well.
  15. Add the prepared gravy to the pan and saute well.
  16. Add cream and mix well.
  17. Garnish it with coriander sprig.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:6
  • 1-liter Full Fat Milk.
  • 1/3 Cup Sugar.
  • 8-10 Saffron strands.
  • 1 tsp Cardamom Powder.
  • ½ Cup Cream.
  • ½ Cup Nuts, chopped.
instructions_unique:
1. Start boiling milk in a heavy bottom pot. Once boiled, lower the flame and keep on simmer.
  2. Stir constantly so as it does not stick to the bottom. Scrap the side and keep stirring till it reduces to the half of its original quantity.
  3. Add sugar and cook for 2-3 mins. Switch off the flame.
  4. Add cardamom powder, nuts and cream and mix well. Let the mixture come to room temperature.
  5. Pour in mixture in kulfi moulds or in matkas to make make matka kulfi. Keep in freezer to set overnight.
  6. To get kulfi out of the mould, rub with your palms, it will get loose and slide out. Garnish with nuts, saffron strands and serve.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:4
  • For Dosa Batter
  • 1 ½ cups raw rice.
  • ¾ cup urad dal, soaked.
  • 1 tsp Fenugreek Seeds, soaked.
  • 2 tsp Chana dal, soaked.
  • 1 tsp Fenugreek Seeds, soaked.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 1 tsp sugar.
  • For Bhaji
  • 1 tbsp Oil.
  • ½ tsp Mustard seeds.
  • 2 green chillies, chopped.
  • ¼ tsp Asafoetida.
  • 6-7 sambhar onions.
  • 2 Large Potatoes, boiled.
  • 6-7 curry leaves.
  • Salt, to taste.
  • Other Ingredients
  • Butter for roasting.
instructions_unique:
1. For Dosa Batter-
  2. Add rice and fenugreek leaves in separate bowls along with sufficient water to soak and soak for 5 hours. Soak chana dal and urad dal separately.
  3. Drain the excess water from soaked rice, fenugreek seeds and chana dal. Transfer to a mixer jar and blend into a smooth paste.
  4. Transfer the prepared paste to an empty and clean bowl. Add sugar and mix well. Set aside till in use.
  5. Cover and set aside in a warm place to ferment for 5 hours.
  6. Once fermented, you will notice that the batter has risen. This is an indication of a well fermented batter.
  7. Add salt once and give this batter a slight mix. Keep aside till in use.
  8. For Bhaji-
  9. Heat oil in a pan. Splutter mustard seeds, green chillies and asafoetida.
  10. Add onions and sautÃ© till they are translucent.
  11. Add boiled potatoes, curry leaves and salt.
  12. Lastly, add coriander leaves and turn off the flame.
  13. For Making Dosa-
  14. Heat a non-stick tawa and pour a ladle full batter on it. Spread it into a circular motion with the help of a ladle.
  15. Add butter on the edges and in the center. Cook on low flame.
  16. Spread a portion of prepared potato mixture all over the dosa.
  17. Cook till crisp and golden brown.
  18. Fold over and serve hot with coconut chutney and sambhar.

ingredients_unique:
• Chicken Momos,Servings:4
  • Stuffing.
  • Chicken mince 200 grams.
  • Onion chopped 2 tablespoons.
  • Green capsicum finely choped 2 teaspoons.
  • Ginger-garlic paste 1 teaspoon.
  • Green chillies chopped 1 teaspoon.
  • Garam masala powder 1 teaspoon.
  • Salt to taste.
  • Soy sauce 1 teaspoon.
  • Lemon juice 1/2 tablespoon.
  • Dough.
  • Refined flour 1 cup.
  • Oil 2 teaspoons.
  • Salt to taste.
  • Momo sauce.
  • Large tomatoes blanched and peeled 2.
  • Dried red chillies boiled 3.
  • Garlic 3-4 cloves.
  • Salt to taste.
  • Sugar to taste.
instructions_unique:
1. To make the stuffing, take chicken mince in a mixing bowl, add onion, capsicum, ginger-garlic paste, green chilli, garam masala powder, salt, soy sauce and lemon juice and mix well.
  2. To make the dough, take refined flour in another mixing bowl, add oil, salt and sufficient water and knead into soft dough. Cover with a damp cloth and rest the dough for 15 minutes.
  3. Heat sufficient water in a steamer with a cover. Apply oil on base.
  4. Divide dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Dust some flour on the worktop and roll each ball into medium slightly thick discs.
  5. Place 1 tbsp stuffing in centre of each disc fold into half-moon shape and press the edges to seal. Bring the two ends together and press gently to a pouch like shape.
  6. Place the momos in the steamer, cover and steam for 10-15 minutes on low heat.
  7. Meanwhile, to make the momo sauce, put the tomatoes in a blender jar, add red chillies, chop and add garlic cloves, salt, sugar and add little water and blend to a fine paste. Transfer into a bowl.
  8. Transfer momos into a serving bamboo bowl lined with a banana leaf and serve hot with the tomato sauce.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:25
  • For Puri.
  • 2 cups Semolina.
  • 1 cup All purpose flour.
  • Salt to taste.
  • ½ cup Warm water.
  • Oil for frying.
  • For Pani Puri ka Pani
  • 2 cups Mint leaves.
  • 1 cup Coriander leaves.
  • 1 inch Ginger, peeled, slice.
  • 2-3 green Chillies, broken.
  • ¼ cup Jaggery.
  • 1 cup Ice cubes.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 2 cup Water.
  • 1 tsp Rock salt.
  • 1 tbsp Roasted Cumin powder.
  • 1 ½ tsp Chaat masala.
  • ? cup Tamarind pulp.
  • ½ cup salted Boondi,
  • For Potato Masala (stuffing)
  • 1 large Potato, boiled.
  • 1 tsp roasted Cumin powder.
  • 1 tsp Rock salt.
  • ½ cup Green Moong, boiled.
  • 1 tsp Chaat masala.
  • 1 tsp Red Chilli powder.
  • For Serving
  • Tamarind chutney.
  • Sev.
  • Salted Boondi.
  • Ragda.
  • Green Moong.
  • Puri.
  • Pani.
instructions_unique:
1. For Puri.
  2. In a parat, add semolina, all purpose flour,salt to taste and warm water as required.
  3. Knead into a stiff dough. Cover it with wet muslin cloth and keep it for rest for 30 minutes.
  4. Roll out the dough and cut it with the help of a round cutter and deep fry it till golden brown colour.
  5. For Pani Puri ka Pani
  6. In a bowl, add mint leaves, ginger, coriander leaves, green chili, jaggery,ice cubes and salt to taste.
  7. Transfer this into a grinder and grind into a smooth paste, add little water while grinding.
  8. Transfer this into a bowl, add black salt. Cumin powder and water mix well and strain it in a deep container.
  9. Add tamarind pulp and salted boondi and mix well.
  10. For potato Masala
  11. In a bowl. Add boil potato and mash well, add cumin powder, black salt, green moong, chaat masala and red chilli powder mix everything well.
  12. Serve with puri, ragda, pani, green moong, tamarind chutney and sev.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:2
  • For Pyaaz ke Pakode:
  • 4 large Onions, thinly sliced(if other types ,choose the same like chilli,or cauliflower accordingly).
  • 3 Green Chillies, finely chopped.
  • ¼ cup Coriander Leaves, finely chopped.
  • ½ cup Yogurt.
  • 1 tsp Ajwain/ Carom Seeds.
  • 1 tsp Red Chilli Powder.
  • 1 tsp Coriander Powder.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 1 ½ cup Gram Flour/ Besan.
  • Coriander sprig for garnishing.
  • Oil for deep frying.
instructions_unique:
1. In a mixing bowl, add onions, green chillies, coriander leaves, yogurt, ajwain, red chilli powder, coriander powder, salt and besan.
  2. Mix everything well and add water as required for making a thick batter.
  3. In a heavy bottom pan, heat oil for deep frying.
  4. Make small balls of the batter with your hand and carefully pour them in oil.
  5. Fry them until crisp and golden brown in colour on high flame.
  6. Remove in an absorbent kitchen paper towel.
  7. Garnish with coriander sprig.
  8. Serve hot mint chutney.
  9. Note:Add water carefully as onion will release it s water

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:2
  • For Bhaji
  • 1 medium size Cauliflower, florets.
  • 1 Capsicum, roughly chopped.
  • ½ inch Ginger, slice.
  • 2-3 Garlic, chopped.
  • Water.
  • 5 medium Potato, cubed.
  • 1 Carrots, pelled, roughly chopped.
  • ? cup Green peas.
  • Salt to taste.
  • 2-3 tbsp Butter.
  • For Tempering
  • 1 cup Onion, chopped.
  • 1 ½ cup Tomato,chopped.
  • 2-3 Green chilli, chopped.
  • 2-3 tbsp Butter.
  • ¼ cup Oil.
  • ½ tbsp Ginger Garlic paste.
  • Salt to taste.
  • ¼ cup fresh Tomato puree.
  • 1 medium Capsicum, chopped.
  • 1 tbsp Degi red chilli powder.
  • 2 tbsp Butter.
  • 1 tbsp Prepared pav bhaji masala.
  • Boiled & mashed vegetables.
  • 1 tbsp Butter.
  • 2 tbsp Prepared pav bhaji masala.
  • Water./
  • ¼ tsp Sugar.
  • 1 tbsp Coriander leaves, chopped.
  • For Toasting Pav
  • 1 tbsp Butter.
  • A pinch of degi red chilli powder.
  • 2 Ladi pav.
  • For Masala Pav
  • 1 tbsp Butter.
  • Prepared Masala.
  • 2 Ladi pav.
  • For Garnish
  • Onion, chopped.
  • Lemon wedge.
  • Butter pav.
  • Coriander sprig.
instructions_unique:
1. For Bhaji.
  2. In a large pot or pressure cooker add cauliflower, capsicum, ginger, garlic, water, potato, carrot, green peas, salt, butter then cover and cook until soft.
  3. Now mash everything properly with a masher and set aside.
  4. For Tempering
  5. In a large tava or a shallow pan heat butter, oil then add onion and saute until translucent.
  6. Now add tomatoes, green chillies, ginger garlic paste, salt and saute until they are soft.
  7. Add fresh tomato puree and continue cooking for 6-8 minutes.
  8. Then add capsicum and continue cooking for another 2 minutes. Once done remove 2-3 tbsp masala aside for further use.
  9. Now, add degi red chilli powder, butter, pav bhaji masala and saute for a minute.
  10. Now, add boiled & mashed vegetables, butter, pav bhaji masala, water, sugar and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes.
  11. Finish the pav bhaji with fresh coriander leaves and switch off the flames.
  12. Serve hot with toasted pav, onion, lemon wedges, coriander leaves.
  13. For Toasting Pav
  14. In a hot pan add butter degi red chilli powder and coat the pav in that inside out and toast it properly, set aside for further use.
  15. For Masala Pav
  16. In a hot pan add butter, prepared masala that was kept aside then coat the pav inside out properly and then toast it. Set aside for further use.

ingredients_unique:
• PanPizza,Servings:2
  • 1 cup All Purpose flour.
  • 1 tsp Sugar.
  • 1 tsp Olive oil.
  • 1 tsp Dry Yeast.
  • 1 tsp Oil.
  • 1 cup Tomato sauce.
  • ½ cup Onions, slices.
  • ½ cup Capsicum, slices.
  • ½ cup Black olives.
  • 1 tsp Dried Herbs.
  • 1 cup Mozzarella Cheese, grated.
  • 1 tsp Pizza seasoning/ Dry herbs.
instructions_unique:
1. For the pizza base, take all-purpose flour in a bowl.
  2. Add sugar, olive oil and dry yeast to it.
  3. Add just enough water to make soft dough. Knead until the gluten is formed and cover the dough and keep it for resting for 30 minutes in a warm and dry place.
  4. Now dust the worktable with flour and knead the dough again to release off the air.
  5. Divide the dough into small balls of equal size.
  6. Now using a rolling pin roll out the balls into half-inch thin circular sheet.
  7. Using a fork poke the base.
  8. Bake the pizza base at 160* Celsius for 8-10 minutes. Remove and keep aside.
  9. Heat oil in a pan, and place the prepared pizza base.
  10. Apply pizza sauce on the base evenly and top it up with sliced onions, capsicum and black olives.
  11. Sprinkle dried herbs on the vegetables and top it up with grated mozzarella cheese.
  12. Cover the pan with a lid and let it cook for 5-6 minutes until the cheese completely melts.
  13. Once cooked, remove off the pan and sprinkle it with pizza seasoning.
  14. Serve hot.

ingredients_unique:
• Servings:4
  • For Dough
  • 1 cup Maida .
  • Salt to taste .
  • ½ tsp Carom seeds.
  • 2 tbsp Ghee .
  • Cold water as required.
  • For Samosa Masala .
  • 1 tbsp Coriander seeds.
  • 1 tbsp Fennel seeds.
  • ½ tbsp Cumin seeds.
  • For Samosa Filling
  • 1 tbsp Ghee.
  • 1 inch Ginger, chopped.
  • 2 fresh Green chillies, chopped.
  • 10-12 Raisins.
  • 1 tsp Turmeric powder.
  • ½ tsp Degi red chilli powder.
  • ¼ tsp Asafoetida.
  • 4-5 Potatoes, boiled & slightly mashed.
  • ¼ cup Green peas.
  • 1 ½ tbsp Prepared Masala.
  • ½ tsp Black pepper powder.
  • 1 tsp Dry Mango powder .
  • Salt to taste .
instructions_unique:
1. For Dough
  2. In a bowl add maida, salt, carom seeds, ghee and mix everything properly until it resembles bread crumb consistency.
  3. Now add cold water and knead a hard dough. Cover and keep aside for resting at least for 15-20 minutes.
  4. For Samosa Masala
  5. In a pan add coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds and roast them lightly.
  6. Transfer them into a motor-pastel and crush them coarsely and keep aside for further use.
  7. For Samosa Filling
  8. In a pan add ghee, ginger, garlic, green chillies and saute for a minute.
  9. Now add raisins, turmeric powder, degi red chilli powder, asafoetida, potatoes, green peas and mash it coarsely, mix everything properly and cover and cook for 4-5 minutes on medium heat.
  10. Now remove the cover and cook on high flames for 3-4 minutes or until light charred.
  11. Add the p.repared masala, black pepper powder, dry Mango powder, salt and mix everything properly. And keep aside for further use.
  12. For Assembling Samosa.
  13. Take a medium portion of the dough, make a round peda and roll it thin in an oval shape.
  14. Now cut in from the centre and take one half of it and make a cone shape of it and add the filling in it.
  15. Now apply water on the open ends of the cone and fold it towards you, keep it down and give it a gentle press so that it can stand, make all others in the similar way.
  16. Heat oil in a kadhai on medium heat and fry the samosas in it until golden brown from all sides, remove on an absorbent paper. Serve hot with tomato ketchup.
